senses.sense_definition: To impose more constraints on a system or problem than are necessary to find a single solution.

examples.text: If you add too many variables, you might <w>overdetermine</w> the system.
Engineers must be careful not to <w>overdetermine</w> the design requirements.

senses.sense_definition: To cause an effect through multiple independent factors, where any single factor would have been sufficient on its own.

examples.text: Various social and economic factors combined to <w>overdetermine</w> the outcome of the election.
The author uses multiple symbols to <w>overdetermine</w> the meaning of the poem.
